revised_title: William Brouncker: Mathematician and First President of the Royal Society
tldr: This article discusses the life and contributions of William Brouncker, the first President of the Royal Society. Brouncker was a skilled mathematician who worked on problems related to the quadrature of the circle and the area under the rectangular hyperbola. He is best known for his continued fraction expansion, which was a significant achievement in early modern mathematics. Brouncker's dedication and service to the Royal Society helped establish it as a leading institution in the scientific community.
